p: In addition to acting on the GABAergic system, the pharmacological effects of EOs may be mediated through other receptor systems. Different species of Achillea are used in folk medicine as sedatives, anti-inflammatory agents, analgesic agents, and anthelmintic (antiparasitic) agents. Majnooni et al. [ 19] reported that the EO of A. wilhelmsii had anxiolytic effects which were probably not mediated through GABA and opioid receptors. Gas chromatography/mass spectrometry (GC/MS) analysis of the EO showed that the main compounds of the oil were p-ocimen (23%), 1, 8-cineole (20.8%), and carvone (19.13%). Pistacia integerrima Stewart ex Brandis galls are used in Indian ethnomedicine for their anti-asthmatic, sedative, and spasmolytic properties. The EO of the plant had relaxant and spasmolytic effects which may be mediated by modulating Î²-adrenoceptors and calcium channels [ 41].
